scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure below 1,500 ft (500m) .

choices.A:
If aircraft is stable, stay with the aircraft and follow directions from the pilot. Ensure 
the student is seated and seat belted
choices.C:
Assure the student that everything is going 
to be okay
choices.B:
If aircraft has catastrophic damage, attach as many attachment points as the 
situation will allow, starting with the upper 
left hook. Hold the student with right arm and legs if needed, exit and immediately 
deploy the reserve
choices.D: A and B is correct

scenarios.rationale: Below 1500 ft: stay with aircraft if stable; if catastrophic, attach, exit, deploy reserve.

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure between 1,500ft (500m) and 4000ft (1200m) .

choices.A: Attach the student, exit the aircraft and immediately deploy the reserve
choices.C: Stay in the aircraft and land with the airplane
choices.B:
Assure to the student that everything is 
going to be okay
choices.D: None of the above

scenarios.rationale: 1500–4000 ft: attach, exit, deploy reserve immediately.

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure above 4,000 ft (1,200 m).

choices.A: Deploy the reserve immediately
choices.B: Stay with the aircraft and land with the airplane
choices.C: Attach the student, exit, set and inflate the drogue, then release drogue
choices.D: None of the above

scenarios.rationale: >4000 ft: attach, exit, set/inflate drogue, then release to main.

scenarios.question: Describe the correct cutaway procedure for a partial malfunction.

choices.A: Deploy the reserve
choices.B: Remove RSL, cutaway, ensure separation, deploy reserve
choices.C: Strip the right, track and pull reserve
choices.D: Cutaway, ensure separation, deploy reserve

scenarios.rationale: Partial malfunction: cutaway → ensure riser separation → deploy reserve.

scenarios.question:
What is the correct procedure for a premature deployment of your main (horseshoe) in which you cannot 
deploy the drogue?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Deploy RESERVE. (Container closed / no drogue / can't set after ~2 attempts or ~10 s.)
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Try to clear fast (≤ ~10 s). If still entangled: DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first). Maintain arch, protect handles, manage two-canopy outcome.

scenarios.rationale: Container open with drogue issues → follow that EP branch.
scenarios.epLabel: Open Container with Drogue Issues (pin already pulled)
scenarios.epDescription: Container is open but main is not deploying correctly due to drogue/bridle/bag issues. No 'immediately' verbiage.

scenarios.question:
Which is the correct response to an inflated drogue (“in tow”) that does not release the main pin during a 
main canopy deployment attempt?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Deploy RESERVE. (Container closed / no drogue / can't set after ~2 attempts or ~10 s.)
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Try to clear fast (≤ ~10 s). If still entangled: DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first). Maintain arch, protect handles, manage two-canopy outcome.

scenarios.rationale: Inflated drogue that doesn't extract pin → container closed → total malfunction.
scenarios.epAction: Left DR → Right DR → Both → Cutaway → Reserve
scenarios.epDescription: Use when the drogue cannot extract the main or an inflated drogue does not release the main pin; container remains closed.

scenarios.question: What is the correct response to an uninflated drogue right after drogue set ?

choices.A:
Wait 6 -8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it 
does not, pull drogue release
choices.C:
Wait 6 -8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it 
does not, Partial Malfunction EP
choices.B:
Wait 6-8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it 
does not, Total Malfunction EP
choices.D:
Dip a shoulder to get clean air into your 
burble

scenarios.rationale: If drogue doesn't inflate, wait ~6–8 s then pull a drogue release.

choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Try to clear fast (≤ ~10 s). If still entangled: DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first). Maintain arch, protect handles, manage two-canopy outcome.

scenarios.question: What should you do if you accidentally pull the drogue release handle before you deploy the drogue?

choices.A: Expect the trap door effect
choices.C: Total Malfunction EP — Deploy RESERVE. (Container closed / no drogue / can't set after ~2 attempts or ~10 s.)
choices.B: Set the drogue
choices.D: Expect main canopy deployment

scenarios.rationale: Pulled release before setting drogue? Set the drogue (no drogue = no main).

scenarios.question: Explain the correct way to pull your reserve or cutaway handles free of their Velcro pockets.

choices.A:
Peel upward and outward, the n pull 
downward
choices.C: Peel using both hands
choices.B: Grab handle and punch down
choices.D: As fast as possible

scenarios.rationale: Peel handles up/out from Velcro, then pull down.

scenarios.question: What would you do if your left shoulder was dislocated, and you needed to pull your reserve?

choices.A:
Pull the reserve handle using your right 
hand
choices.C:
Nothing, the AAD will activate at 2000ft 
(600m)
choices.B:
Ask the student to pull the reserve handle 
for you
choices.D:
Disconnect RSL and pull upwards using 
the RSL Lanyard to deploy the reserve

scenarios.rationale: Use RSL lanyard method if shoulder injured and reserve needed.

scenarios.question: What is the primary cause of tandem incidents that result in a fatality ?

choices.A: Poor gear maintenance
choices.C: Instructor error
choices.B: Poor packing
choices.D: Canopy collisions

scenarios.rationale: Primary causal factor historically: instructor error.

scenarios.question: What is the procedure for a videographer caught in your drogue bridle?

choices.A: Total Malfunction EP — Deploy RESERVE. (Container closed / no drogue / can't set after ~2 attempts or ~10 s.)
choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP — DISCONNECT RSL → CUTAWAY → CLEAR RISERS → PULL RESERVE.
choices.B: Partial Malfunction EP — CUTAWAY → ensure separation / clear risers → DEPLOY RESERVE.
choices.D: Third Party Entanglement EP — Try to clear fast (≤ ~10 s). If still entangled: DEPLOY RESERVE (no cutaway first). Maintain arch, protect handles, manage two-canopy outcome.

scenarios.rationale: Videographer in your bridle → third-party entanglement EP.
scenarios.epAction: Attempt to clear; if not clear by ~10 s after exit → Reserve
scenarios.epDescription: Treat as entanglement; if neither jumper has a good canopy by ~3000 ft, both deploy reserves.

scenarios.question:
In an entanglement scenario where both jumpers have no good canopy and are below 3000ft (900m) , what 
should the entangled parachutists do ?

choices.A: Both jumpers deploy their reserves
choices.C:
The higher jumper initiates cutaway first, 
followed by the lower jumper
choices.B:
The lower jumper initiates cutaway to 
increase separation
choices.D:
Both jumpers disconnect RSLs and 
attempt to climb above the other

scenarios.rationale: Below 3000 ft with no good canopies: lower jumper cuts away to increase separation.

scenarios.question: What is the proper instructor action in a high wind landing with no ground assistance available?

choices.A: Loosen the chest strap
choices.C: Have the student sit back in the harness
choices.B: Reposition the leg straps
choices.D: All of the above

scenarios.rationale: High winds: collapse canopy; if not, disconnect RSL and cutaway.

scenarios.question: What can be done, after opening the main canopy, to make the student’s harness more comfortable?

choices.A: Loosen the chest strap
choices.B: Reposition the leg straps
choices.C: Have the student sit back in the harness
choices.D: All of the above

scenarios.rationale: Loosen chest strap, reposition leg straps, and have student sit back.

scenarios.question: The Side Lateral Connections must be detached, loosened, and reattached where ?

choices.A: Instructor side lateral connection rings
choices.C: They should never be detached
choices.B: Onto the student harness
choices.D: There is no need to reattach anywhere

scenarios.rationale: Side laterals reattach onto the student harness.
